basics.name: Joshua Pedersen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences, and a Minor in Mathematics at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

courses: Introduction to Computer Science I & II (Data Structures), Discrete Math I & II, Program Structure, Algorithms,  Linear Algebra, Software Engineering I (Ongoing), Security and Trust I (Ongoing)

work.summary: Assist students with precalculus homework and recitation worksheets. Provide guidance and clarification on mathematical concepts and problem-solving strategies.
highlights: Set up and manage regular office hours outside of the classroom to offer personalized assistance to students. Address studentsâ€™ questions and concerns related to math coursework.
Tutor, providing one-on-one, group, and in-class tutoring sessions to help students understand complex math concepts.

work.summary: Successfully annotated results of complex datasets
highlights: Understanding of cybersecurity concepts and methodologies
Worked with project members to refine annotation guidelines, enhancing the quality and consistency of annotated data.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Deans List
awards.summary: Semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade.

awards.title: Phi Theta Kappa Honors Society
awards.summary: International honor society of students attending open-access institutions and seeking further education.
